pull.title: Add depends qt fix for ARM macs
pull.body: With this, depends builds fine on macOS 11 on an Apple Silicon Mac (ARM64).

events.message: Add depends qt fix for ARM macs

events.body: cross compiling apple arm64 (aarch64-apple-darwin) on a linux host will requires some more work.

Concept ACK.

Did you check if various aarch64 assembly bits (libsecp256k1?) work correclty? I seem to recall reading that Apple's aarch64 isn't 100% compatible with normal aarch64...

P.S. AIUI, aarch64 is not actually related to the 'arm' architecture.

> Did you check if various aarch64 assembly bits (libsecp256k1?) work correclty? I seem to recall reading that Apple's aarch64 isn't 100% compatible with normal aarch64...

I did a full IBD on an apple ARM64 M1 (not using the Rosetta 2 X86 virtualisation).

> P.S. AIUI, aarch64 is not actually related to the 'arm' architecture.

AFAIK AArch64 is an optional 64bit architecture implemented by >=ARMv8? But it is confusing anyways.
@luke-jr libsecp256k1 only has 32-bit ARM asm code, and it's not enabled by default in Bitcoin Core builds.
Concept ACK, glad so see that it built with so few changes.

issue.title: Add macOS ARM build (universal or additional binaries)
issue.body:
First ARM based Macs are available now.
See the porting guide https://developer.apple.com/documentation/xcode/porting_your_macos_apps_to_apple_silicon and the architectural differences: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_silicon/addressing_architectural_differences_in_your_macos_code

Things to do:
* [x] fix depends build on ARM with macOS 10.16 (done in merged #20482)
* [x] fix CRC32 build issue (fix in #20603)
* [x] update macOS build readme (if required)
* [x] allow cross compiling ARM64 Mac on linux/gitian
* [x] fix `make deploy` on ARM64

### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

issue.title: build: Qt 5.15.x
issue.body: Opening this for visibility. Apart from it probably being time to use a newer version of Qt for releases, an update is required so that we are using a version which has a C++17 mode. There's a lot of commits here, because I've made some changes (like rebasing our patches), that aren't strictly necessary. There are also some changes, like bumping the minimum required macOS version, that will likely happen separate, as part of the C++17 migration. So this change will end up being a bit smaller. The biggest change here is that [Qt no longer has internal xcb libs](https://codereview.qt.nokia.com/c/qt/qtbase/+/253905), so we need to build the requirements ourselves. This also means some additional build-time tools, such as `yacc` (from `bison`) are also required; to build xkbcommon. I've tested this on Ubuntu; although it'd be great if more people could test with their particular brand of Linux desktop. Cross-compiled Windows and macOS builds compile and run, but the GUI currently looks a bit broken on both. i.e macOS seems to look a bit like an older version of Windows: I haven't had enough time to fully investigate (also why there's some WIP commits), so if anyone wants to dig in and see what Qt has changed since 5.9.x feel free.

Concept ACK - no hardware to test this on though.
Looks like this upstream bug is not solved in any releases. So it won't just go away with a more recent Qt (at least not one we're going to upgrade to before 0.22).

issue.title: depends: Fix qt.mk for mac arm64
issue.body: With f16d4cd8c5412890ee0b73f4ef142b59d130e5d5 `depends/config.guess` gives `aarch64-apple-darwin20.3.0` where before would give `arm-apple-darwin20.3.0`. Fix `qt.mk` accordingly.
